title: Apollo 11 Launch
description: Apollo 11 was launched from Kennedy Space Center aboard a Saturn V rocket.

title: Translunar Injection
description: The spacecraft performed a maneuver to set it on course toward the Moon.

title: Entering Lunar Orbit
description: Apollo 11 entered the Moon's orbit after traveling approximately 240,000 miles.

title: Lunar Module Separation
description: The Lunar Module, 'Eagle,' separated from the Command Module for descent to the Moon.

title: First Moon Landing
description: Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin successfully landed the Lunar Module on the Moon's surface.

title: First Moonwalk
description: Neil Armstrong became the first human to step onto the Moon, followed by Buzz Aldrin.

title: Planting the Flag
description: Armstrong and Aldrin planted the U.S. flag on the Moon's surface.

title: Lunar Module Liftoff
description: The Lunar Module lifted off from the Moon's surface to rendezvous with the Command Module.

title: Splashdown and Recovery
description: Apollo 11 safely splashed down in the Pacific Ocean and was recovered by the USS Hornet.

title: Quarantine Period
description: The astronauts were placed in quarantine to prevent potential contamination from lunar material.

title: Ticker Tape Parade
description: New York City welcomed Apollo 11 astronauts Neil A. Armstrong, Lt. Col. Michael Collins, Col. Buzz Aldrin with an exuberant ticker-tape reception to applaud their moon landing three weeks earlier on July 20.
